credit_line: Gift of James Fowle, Class of 1941
title: Untitled: House in a landscape
description: term is a misnomer - neither a painting nor made on sandpaper.  Sandpaper painting is a contemporary term used because the marble-dust coated surface on which the artists worked resembles modern-day sandpaper.
inscriptions: verso u.c. in ink on frame: Jim Fowle; verso l.r. in white chalk on frame backing: 250 [underlined]
